Live footage and eyewitness accounts: TV stations aired live footage of a plane striking the World Trade Center on 9/11, and there are thousands of witnesses who also saw the planes strike the Twin Towers.
Existence of plane wreckage: Large pieces of the airplanes were found around Ground Zero, as documented by the U.S. Department of Homeland Security in 2002. Additionally, a fragment of one of the planes is on display at the 9/11 Memorial and Museum in New York.
Expert analysis and debunking: Researchers at Popular Mechanics Magazine published a book debunking theories that the planes weren't actually planes, but missiles or something else. They provided evidence and analysis to refute these claims.
Inconsistencies in alternative theories: Conspiracy theorists have argued that jet fuel can't melt steel beams, but it has been explained that the fuel doesn't need to melt the beams in order to damage them. These inconsistencies in alternative theories support the authenticity of the claim that planes caused the collapse of the Twin Towers.
